segment.source: Developing, Testing, and Deploying Drivers
segment.target: Developing, Testing, and Deploying Drivers

segment.source: Starting with Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 8, the Windows driver development environment and the Windows debuggers are integrated into Microsoft Visual Studio.
segment.target: Starting with Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 8, the Windows driver development environment and the Windows debuggers are integrated into Microsoft Visual Studio.

segment.source: In this integrated driver development environment, most of the tools you need for coding, building, packaging, deploying, debugging, and testing a driver are available in the Visual Studio user interface.
segment.target: In this integrated driver development environment, most of the tools you need for coding, building, packaging, deploying, debugging, and testing a driver are available in the Visual Studio user interface.

segment.source: This is a departure from previous releases of the Windows Driver Kit (WDK), where the various stages of the driver life cycle were performed as separate tasks with stand-alone tools.
segment.target: This is a departure from previous releases of the Windows Driver Kit (WDK), where the various stages of the driver life cycle were performed as separate tasks with stand-alone tools.

segment.source: To set up the integrated development environment, first install Visual Studio and then install the WDK.
segment.target: To set up the integrated development environment, first install Visual Studio and then install the WDK.

segment.source: You can find information about how to get Visual Studio and the WDK here.
segment.target: You can find information about how to get Visual Studio and the WDK here.

segment.source: Debugging Tools for Windows is included when you install the WDK.
segment.target: Debugging Tools for Windows is included when you install the WDK.

segment.source: For more information, see Download and Install Debugging Tools for Windows.
segment.target: For more information, see Download and Install Debugging Tools for Windows.

segment.source: WDK 8 uses MSBuild.exe, which is a different build utility from the one used in previous releases.
segment.target: WDK 8 uses MSBuild.exe, which is a different build utility from the one used in previous releases.

segment.source: (Previous releases used Build.exe, which was available only in a command-line environment.) MSBuild is available both in the Visual Studio user interface and as a command-line tool.
segment.target: (Previous releases used Build.exe, which was available only in a command-line environment.) MSBuild is available both in the Visual Studio user interface and as a command-line tool.

segment.source: Driver projects created with previous releases of the WDK used Sources (and possibly Dirs) files to describe a project or group of projects.
segment.target: Driver projects created with previous releases of the WDK used Sources (and possibly Dirs) files to describe a project or group of projects.

segment.source: Drivers created with the Visual Studio environment use Project and Solution files instead of Sources and Dirs files.
segment.target: Drivers created with the Visual Studio environment use Project and Solution files instead of Sources and Dirs files.

segment.source: The Visual Studio environment provides a tool for converting Sources and Dirs files to Project and Solution files.
segment.target: The Visual Studio environment provides a tool for converting Sources and Dirs files to Project and Solution files.

segment.source: The Visual Studio environment provides templates for:
segment.target: The Visual Studio environment provides templates for:

segment.source: New drivers
segment.target: New drivers

segment.source: Driver packages
segment.target: Driver packages

segment.source: New tests
segment.target: New tests

segment.source: Enhancement of existing tests
segment.target: Enhancement of existing tests

segment.source: Custom driver deployment scripts
segment.target: Custom driver deployment scripts

segment.source: In the Visual Studio environment, you can configure the build process so that it automatically creates and signs a driver package.
segment.target: In the Visual Studio environment, you can configure the build process so that it automatically creates and signs a driver package.

segment.source: Static and run-time analysis tools are available in Visual Studio.
segment.target: Static and run-time analysis tools are available in Visual Studio.

segment.source: You can configure a target computer for testing your driver and automatically deploy your driver to the target computer each time you rebuild.
segment.target: You can configure a target computer for testing your driver and automatically deploy your driver to the target computer each time you rebuild.

segment.source: In Visual Studio you can establish a kernel-mode debugging session with a target computer.
segment.target: In Visual Studio you can establish a kernel-mode debugging session with a target computer.

segment.source: You can choose from an extensive set of run-time tests, and you can write your own tests.
segment.target: You can choose from an extensive set of run-time tests, and you can write your own tests.

segment.source: These topics show you how to use Visual Studio to perform several of the tasks involved in driver development, deployment, and testing.
segment.target: These topics show you how to use Visual Studio to perform several of the tasks involved in driver development, deployment, and testing.
